bench

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • bench.Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client.ClientManager, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Client.ClientManager
    Run and Manage multi-client SQL benchmark tests. This class handles the complete distributed benchmark test. Actual running of benchmark clients is done by the Client class, and all DBMS and SQL management functions are in the Database class. One running instance of this class is launched on each host running benchmark clients. TODO Orchestrate multiple Drivers in a run
    Author:
    dhentchel

      • computeClientID

        public static long computeClientID(TestContext ctx,
                   long threadID)
        Determine a canonical, unique Client ID for a given Client thread. This combines the driverID number and threadID number to give a unique long value.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Load the database and run the benchmark. This is a multi-threaded SQL benchmark. The __runFlag__ object is used to gate the starting and stopping of client threads. If the 'doload' flag is set, the database is pre-loaded, using the loadscriptfile; this script should recreate and load tables to ensure that the database is returned to a known state. Then the client threads are launched and notified to start executing SQL transactions. In the run phase, the clients execute the configured runscriptfile script. During execution, the program periodically prints the current TPS rate and the accumulated number of errors. Upon completion, a brief report is printed summarizing transaction and error counts, along with overall transactions per second.
        Parameters:
        args - [-help] [-debug] [host=VAL] [port=VAL] [dbname=VAL] [user=VAL] [password=VAL]
